intro: Cryptotaenia canadensis f. atropurpurea, commonly known as purple-leaf cowbane, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its foliage often exhibits a striking purple or reddish hue, especially on the underside, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
